_header: Right as the star of day began to shine
_description: William Dunbar, The Golden Targe — thirty-one 9-line stanzas

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
Richt as the sterne of day begouth to schyneQuhen gon to bed was
                    vesper and lucyne…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…Rude is thy weid destenit bair and rentWeill aucht thow
                    efferrit of the licht
CamMagPep2553.Attributed Title:
The goldin targe (p. 64); Explicit the goldin targe compylit be maister
                    William dunbar (p. 81)

Banna.First Lines:
Rycht as the sterne of day began to schyneQuhen gone to bed wes
                    vesper and lucyne…
Banna.Last Lines:
…Rude Is thy weid destitute bair and rentWeill aucht thow be
                    affeirit of þe licht
Banna.Note:
Treated as one of Henryson’s Fables, having title added by a later
                    hand to right margin, ‘Fable XV. The Goldin Terge’ (f.
                    345).
Banna.Attributed Author:
Explicit quod dumbar of the goldin terge (scribal, f.
                    348v)
Banna.Attributed Title:
The Goldin Terge (added by later hand, f. 345); Followis the goldin terge
                    (scribal, f. 345); Explicit quod dumbar of the goldin terge (scribal, f.
                        348v)
